docs.title: Pre-work
docs.text:
This section is broken up into the following steps:

  1. Sign up for IBM Cloud
  2. Download or clone the repo

docs.title: 1. Sign up for IBM Cloud
docs.text: Ensure you have an IBM Cloud ID

docs.title: 2. Download or clone the repo
docs.text:
Various parts of this workshop will require the attendee to upload files or run scripts that we've stored in the repository. So let's get that done early on, you'll need git on your laptop to clone the repository directly, or access to GitHub.com to download the zip file.

To Download, go to the GitHub repo for this workshop and download the archived version of the workshop and extract it on your laptop.

Alternately, run the following command:

git clone https://github.com/IBM/workshop-template
cd workshop-template

docs.title: mkdocs examples
docs.text: This page includes a few neat tricks that you can do with mkdocs. For a complete list of examples visit the mkdocs documentation.

docs.title: Code
docs.text: print("hello world!")

docs.title: Code with line numbers
docs.text:
def bubble_sort(items):
    for i in range(len(items)):
        for j in range(len(items) - 1 - i):
            if items[j] > items[j + 1]:
                items[j], items[j + 1] = items[j + 1], items[j]

docs.title: Code with highlights
docs.text:
def bubble_sort(items):
    for i in range(len(items)):
        for j in range(len(items) - 1 - i):

Windows

MacOS

Run brew install foo.

Linux

Run apt-get install foo.

docs.title: Call outs
docs.text:
Tip

You can use note, abstract, info, tip, success, question warning, failure, danger, bug, quote or example.

Note

A note.

Abstract

An abstract.

Info

Some info.

Success

A success.

Question

A question.

Warning

A warning.

Danger

A danger.

Example

A example.

Bug

A bug.

def bubble_sort(items):
    for i in range(len(items)):
        for j in range(len(items) - 1 - i):
            if items[j] > items[j + 1]:
                items[j], items[j + 1] = items[j + 1], items[j]

docs.title: Formatting
docs.text:

  • strike-through
